definition: rendering (computing)/to add washes of ink or color to a drawing (Chinese painting)/to exaggerate/to embellish
to dye/to catch (a disease)/to acquire (bad habits etc)/to contaminate/to add color washes to a painting

sentences.english: More responsive page rendering using lazy frame construction.
sentences.chinese: 更多的反應型頁面渲染使用懶人框架結構。

sentences.english: The benefit from this, however, will be re-optimized rendering performance.
sentences.chinese: 這得益於然而，將重新優化渲染性能。

sentences.english: Setup a matrix for pixel-correct rendering.
sentences.chinese: 設置一個矩陣用於像素矯正渲染。

sentences.english: The renderer determines the quality of your final render.
sentences.chinese: 渲染器決定了你最後的渲染質量。

sentences.english: The renderer determines the quality of your final render.
sentences.chinese: 渲染器決定了你最後的渲染質量。

sentences.english: After the romance of the Ming and Qing novel, the ghost town appears more mystery to people.
sentences.chinese: 經明清小說的渲染，豐都鬼城更加神祕怪誕。

sentences.english: I use the strong contrast of the color to romance the picture and extrude the subject.
sentences.chinese: 以反差強烈的色彩渲染畫面，突出主題。

sentences.english: My renderings are usually no larger than 750 pixels wide.
sentences.chinese: 我的渲染圖像通常都不超過750像素寬。

sentences.english: The rendering process included two stages: water surface modeling and illumination simulation.
sentences.chinese: 該渲染過程分爲兩個階段，即水面建模和光照實現。

sentences.english: How about selecting a Bible verse or two to fit Father's Day?
sentences.chinese: 選擇一兩句聖詩來渲染父親節的氣氛怎麼樣呢？

sentences.english: Don't get caught up in trying to get perfect renders out of your 3D package.
sentences.chinese: 別爲了得到完美的渲染效果而在3D軟件裏大花時間。

sentences.english: The director cleverly atmosphered the film for added chills.
sentences.chinese: 導演手法巧妙地着意渲染使電影更增添恐怖氣氛。

sentences.english: See the Renderers Example for a live demo that uses custom renderers.
sentences.chinese: 現場演示一下自定義渲染器渲染。

sentences.english: See the Renderers Example for a live demo that uses custom renderers.
sentences.chinese: 現場演示一下自定義渲染器渲染。

sentences.english: Golden dome light for the whole space of the coloured glaze apply colours to a drawing gives bright and rich color.
sentences.chinese: 琉璃的金色頂燈爲整個空間渲染出明亮富麗的色彩。

definition: background (of a painting)/backdrop/a foil (to set off something to advantage)/to offset (something to advantage)
to arrange/to spread out/to narrate in detail/to describe at great length/to elaborate
to shine on/(math., linguistics etc) mapping
to trace over/to take a copy (of a calligraphy, a painting etc)/(fig.) to describe/to portray
to draw the outline of/to outline/to sketch/to delineate contours of/to give a brief account of
to be contaminated/to be gradually influenced
to paint/to whitewash/to decorate/plaster/fig. to gloss over/to cover up
brush stroke in Chinese painting and calligraphy/brushwork/style of drawing or writing
